218.sentence: I installed, activated and registered NIS 2004 without issue.

219.sentence: So far, the Anti-Spam feature seems to be very good.

220.sentence: This program would not let me send Outlook Email or listen to Audible sample books online.

221.sentence: Buy this if you like mental challenges or trying how to pick locks.

222.sentence: I had much of the same problems that everyone else has listed (mainly the SLOOOOOOOOOW processor), and then I couldn't get the damn thing off my computer completely!

223.sentence: It locked during install and I had to reformat the drive and start from scratch (GRRRRRR!)

224.sentence: I downloaded a trial version of Computer Associates EZ Firewall and Antivirus and fell in love with a computer security system all over again.

225.sentence: And I can't warn you enough to STAY AWAY FROM NORTON!!

226.sentence: I did not have any of the installation problems that people highlighted here.

227.sentence: It was immediately noticeable that NIS slows down my computer (Pent4, 256 RAM).

228.sentence: I think it is a combination of the program size taking up resources and the open/close scanning that it does with every program.

229.sentence: I think it is a combination of the program size taking up resources and the open/close scanning that it does with every program.

230.sentence: Is it necessary to scan my MS Money database when I close the program?

231.sentence: I have a modern PC with lots of speed and memory, but this firewall just brought it to a halt.

232.sentence: Start up, log off, log on...everything became very slow.

233.sentence: Configuring it for a home network was almost impossible.

234.sentence: Multiple users on one machine never seemed to behave like you'd expect.

235.sentence: While I was trying to play Half Life 2 it started popping up with "alerts" every twenty seconds (literally), warning me my antivirus protection was off.

236.sentence: But it wouldn't let me turn the AV protection back on and it wouldn't stop with the alerts.

237.sentence: I had tried to uninstall Norton Internet Security a few weeks ago, and it wouldn't let me do that either.

238.sentence: I tried it again this morning and it said I didn't have the required "permissions" and lacked proper administrator status.

239.sentence: Of course, if you try to reach Symantec customer service you get useless automated systems unless you want to pay $30 per incident.

240.sentence: This time, it started the uninstallation process, then I left for work. I think it will work. I hope it will work.

241.sentence: I simply hate Symantec. I swear, if I could have physically ripped that software out of my computer with my bare, bleeding hands, I would have.

242.sentence: Their products have been great and have saved my bacon on numerous occasions.
